intro: Morongia aculeata, commonly known as the spiked morong, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy, often spiny stems. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. Morongia aculeata is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in diverse conditions.
